# utils.permute_columns { #pyLHD.utils.permute_columns }

`utils.permute_columns(arr, columns=None, seed=None)`

Random permute columns in a numpy ndarray

## Parameters

| Name      | Type                    | Description                                                                                                                 | Default    |
|-----------|-------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| `arr`     | npt.ArrayLike           | A numpy ndarray                                                                                                             | _required_ |
| `columns` | Optional\[List\[int\]\] | If columns is None all columns will be randomly permuted, otherwise provide a list of columns to permute. Defaults to None. | `None`     |
| `seed`    | Optional\[int\]         | If seed is an int or None, a new numpy.random.Generator is created using np.random.default_rng(seed). Defaults to None.     | `None`     |

## Returns

| Type          | Description                                            |
|---------------|--------------------------------------------------------|
| npt.ArrayLike | numpy ndarray with columns of choice randomly permuted |

## Examples



```{python}
import pyLHD
x = pyLHD.random_lhd(n_rows = 5, n_columns = 3, seed = 1)
x
```
Permute all columns
```{python}
pyLHD.permute_columns(x)
```
Permute columns [0,1] with `seed=1`
```{python}
pyLHD.permute_columns(x, columns = [0,1], seed = 1)
```
